document_notes.text:
This update for frr fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2023-38802: Fixed bad length handling in BGP attribute handling (bsc#1213284). 
- CVE-2023-41358: Fixed crash in bgpd/bgp_packet.c (bsc#1214735).
- CVE-2023-41360: Fixed out-of-bounds read in bgpd/bgp_packet.c (bsc#1214739).
- CVE-2023-3748: Fixed inifinite loop in babld message parsing may cause DoS (bsc#1213434).
- CVE-2023-41909: Fixed NULL pointer dereference due to processing in bgp_nlri_parse_flowspec (bsc#1215065).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in FRRouting when parsing certain babeld unicast hello messages that are intended to be ignored. This issue may allow an attacker to send specially crafted hello messages with the unicast flag set, the interval field set to 0, or any TLV that contains a sub-TLV with the Mandatory flag set to enter an infinite loop and cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: FRRouting FRR 7.5.1 through 9.0 and Pica8 PICOS 4.3.3.2 allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted BGP update with a corrupted attribute 23 (Tunnel Encapsulation).
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgpd/bgp_packet.c processes NLRIs if the attribute length is zero.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgpd/bgp_packet.c can read the initial byte of the ORF header in an ahead-of-stream situation.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgp_nlri_parse_flowspec in bgpd/bgp_flowspec.c processes malformed requests with no attributes, leading to a NULL pointer dereference.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
